artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Carver: Takimoto Chokuzan; Publisher: Daikokuya Heikichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 502; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 219, p. 291.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets/vertical orientation; man at bottom wearing lavender pants, light blue belt and white blouse, with hands clasped and eyes closed, holding a cloth (?) between clenched teeth; birds flying around man; second standing man at top wearing colorful armor over a green garment with blue, tan and yellow floral patterns, with a snake behind him
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: 直山刀 {Chokuzan tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled series of upright diptychs
title: Picture of Hakamadare Yasusuke and Kidōmaru Fighting with Magic
